text: Fibroblast growth factors ( FGFs ) are heparin - binding proteins crucial to embryogenesis , angiogenesis , and wound healing .
<extra_id_0> FGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is abundantly expressed in the synovium in rheumatoid arthritis and in rejecting allografts , sites of chronic immune - mediated inflammation .

The frequency of <extra_id_0> FGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - responsive T cells is increased in the peripheral blood of these disorders , and a high percentage of infiltrating T cells in rheumatoid arthritis synovium express receptors for <extra_id_0> FGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

To understand the action of <extra_id_0> FGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in T cells , studies were initiated in Jurkat T cells that express the signaling isoform of <extra_id_0> FGF receptor-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

These experiments show that <extra_id_0> FGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation of Jurkat T cells provides a second signal that augments TCR - mediated <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production .

text: Analogous to costimulation via <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , this activity is mediated through activation of Rel / kappaB , a family of transcription factors known to regulate <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and other activation - inducible proteins .

<extra_id_0> FGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone induces modest nuclear translocation of kappaB - binding proteins , and this translocation is enhanced by the combination of anti-CD3 and <extra_id_0> FGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

This NF-kappaB binding complex is composed of transcriptionally active <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> heterodimers and results primarily from the targeted degradation of <extra_id_0> IkappaB-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , an inhibitor that sequesters Rel / kappaB in the cytoplasm .

text: These data are the first to show a connection between <extra_id_0> FGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling and NF-kappaB activation outside of embryonic development .

The signaling events that link <extra_id_0> FGF receptor-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> engagement and NF-kappaB activation in Jurkat are probably distinct from the <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> costimulation pathway , since <extra_id_0> FGF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced Rel / kappaB binding proteins do not contain significant levels of <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and are not identical with the <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> response complex .
